content.question: The function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous, and <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is a function such that <math alttext="g prime of x, equals f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>. Which of the following is equal to <math alttext="the integral from 6 to 10, of, f of, open parenthesis, one half x, close parenthesis, d x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo stretchy="true">∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>x</mi></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> in terms of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half times g of 5, minus, one half times g of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="4.0ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mrow></math>

<math alttext="one half times g of 10, minus, one half times g of 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>⁢</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="2 times g of 5, minus, 2 times g of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="2 times g of 10, minus, 2 times g of 6" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="2 times g of 5, minus, 2 times g of 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mrow><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
